item.description:
Is "Happy Lent" an oxymoron? We couldn't say, but there's no denying
that this time of year generates a lot of temporary, reluctant
vegetarians -- which means that it is also a good time for chefs to
become even more creative than usual when it comes to good vegetarian
cuisine. At the Red Lentil in Watertown, however, this level of
creativity happens on a daily basis. That's probably why the
restaurant was recently written up in the Globe as one of the top
vegetarian eateries in the greater Boston area. Vegetarian meals also
tend to be easier on the pocketbook, so those of us who are awaiting a
tax refund or dreading the check they'll have to write to Uncle Sam
next month can probably afford to indulge!

Some things to be aware of before you R.S.V.P:  As usual with our
restaurant meetups, there is a $3 reservation fee to reserve your
spot. If you cancel within 24 hours, email the Organizer to request
your refund. These fees get added to the tax and tip for the table and
help simplify the breakdown of the bill, so you are not actually
paying just to attend a meetup! Also, this restaurant does NOT have a
liquor license and Watertown does not have a BYOB policy. If you
simply must have alcohol with your meal, please join us at a different
event. (If the group wants to grab a beer or glass of wine before or
after dinner, though, we can probably arrange it. Post a comment about
this if you want to see it happen.
item.name: A vegetarian venture for Lent
